SENT.plain: A 14-year-old girl with sickle cell disease and nephrotic syndrome developed bone pain, followed by pulmonary edema, seizures, coma, and bilateral flaccid paralysis
Fat embolism syndrome was diagnosed by cranial magnetic resonance imaging and an exchange transfusion was performed
Within 3 months, all symptoms had resolved
It is concluded that fat embolism syndrome must be considered as a possible cause of acute neurologic deterioration in patients with sickle cell anemia
